result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence Lee Lester was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: With credit for 7 days time served.

miscConds.notes: AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Obtain and maintain employment or attend school.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children subject to any other court orders.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Cooperate with all CHIPS and MBCW orders.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens. Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Serve 30 days as to Count 2 and 15 days as to Count 3 in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: With credit for 0 days time served.

timeConds.notes: *7/20/2015  COMMITMENT ordered/signed. Stay lifted as to 45 days. Straight time.  No good time credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence Lee Lester

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Condtions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed (45 days straight time).  rmm
Letter in response to defendant's request to modify no contact order.

Defendant Lawrence Lee Lester in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Sarah S.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 7 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 3 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.
.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days as to Count 2 and 15 days as to Count 3 in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children subject to any other court orders.
-Cooperate with all CHIPS and MBCW orders.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment or attend school.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lawrence Lee Lester in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  State informed the Court the alleged victim is on her way.  Case passed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm
Final Pretrial held. Defense requested video discovery from the State.  Case remains set for jury trial on 06/08/15 in Branch 40.

Defendant Lawrence Lee Lester in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing on No Contact Order held.  Statements made by: Sarah S. Court denied motion to modify the No Contact Order.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.
For Bail Reduction or Modification by Defense recieved and filed.

Defendant Lawrence Lee Lester in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Br. 4 for Br. 40.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Offer will be forthcoming to defense counsel, per the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 40 on 5-14-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 6-8-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Sarah S., or her children or Charles F., no possession of dangerous weapons, cooperate with Justice Point Supervision and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld
Court is in trial and cannot hear this matter.  Branch 4 agreed to take it for waiver of preliminary hearing.  rmm

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Sarah S or her children; Charles F.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lawrence Lee Lester in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  
Defendant Lawrence Lee Lester in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to  all Misdemeanor Counts.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
